titleStmt.title: Recto, Contract|Verso, Account, Roman CE iii [HIB]|After CE 253-254 [RD]

msContents.summary: Two separate documents are recorded on the recto and verso of this papyrus. The recto preserves the end of a contract, which displays subscriptions in different hands; Valerian, Gallien and Valerian Caesar. The verso records an account of money.

msItemStruct.note: This papyrus previously had two inventory numbers (P.CtYBR inv. 152A and 152B), which have been consolidated into one.

Margins: Recto, Left? and bottom?
Verso, top right (?) bottom
Bound in acrylic, but not yet conserved.

provenance.p:
Provenance Purchased: Medinet el-Faiyum
Provenance Written: Oxyrhynchus?

acquisition.p:
Acquisition Information, 1927: Purchased in Egypt on behalf of Yale, with funds that may have been donated by the General Education Fund of the Rockefeller Foundation's General Education Board. The dealers' names are given as Harold Idris Bell reported them in his 1927 report.
P.CtYBR inv. 152-159 and 2079 were purchased by Harold Idris Bell from Tadaros in Medinet el-Faiyum, 24 December 1926.

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

figure.note: Images of P.CtYBR inv. 152 are available at Yale University Library's Digital Collections website
